intro: Cyrtogonellum salicifolium, commonly known as the willow-leaf hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive willow-like appearance, hence its common name. Cyrtogonellum salicifolium produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
